sync.firebase package

sync.firebase.utils module

sync.firebase.utils.copy(firebase_source_path, firebase_destination_path)[source]

Copies files from the specified Firebase source path to the specified Firebase destination path.

Parameters:

  • firebase_source_path – (str) The Firebase source path to copy files from.

  • firebase_destination_path – (str) The Firebase destination path to copy files to.

Returns:

(list) A list of tuples containing the source file name and the destination file name.

sync.firebase.utils.delete(firebase_path)[source]

Deletes all files in the specified Firebase path.

Parameters:

firebase_path – (str) The Firebase path to delete files from.

Returns:

(list) A list of deleted file names.

sync.firebase.utils.download(local_path='/Users/cbettis/git/lazarus/impl_utils/downloads', firebase_path='imp-dev/cris/')[source]

Downloads files from the specified Firebase path to the local folder.

Parameters:

  • local_path – (str) The local folder to download files to.

  • firebase_path – (str) The Firebase path to download files from.

Returns:

(list) A list of tuples containing the original file path and the local file path.

sync.firebase.utils.file_exists(firebase_path)[source]

Checks if a file or folder exists in the specified Firebase path.

Parameters:

firebase_path – (str) The Firebase path to check.

Returns:

(bool) True if the file or folder exists, False otherwise.

sync.firebase.utils.get_url(firebase_path)[source]

Generates a presigned URL for accessing a file in the specified Firebase path.

Parameters:

firebase_path – (str) The Firebase path to the file.

Returns:

(str) The presigned URL, or None if the file does not exist.

sync.firebase.utils.list_files(firebase_path='imp-dev/cris/', recursive=False)[source]

Lists all files in the specified Firebase path.

Parameters:

  • firebase_path – (str) The Firebase path to list files from.

  • recursive – (bool) If True, include subdirectories; otherwise, only list files in the specified directory.

Returns:

(list) A list of file paths.

sync.firebase.utils.upload(local_path='/Users/cbettis/git/lazarus/impl_utils/working', firebase_path='imp-dev/cris/', recursive=False)[source]

Uploads a local file or folder to the specified Firebase path.

Parameters:

  • local_path – (str) The local file or folder path to upload.

  • firebase_path – (str) The Firebase path to upload the file or folder to.

  • recursive – (bool) If True, upload subdirectories; otherwise, only upload files in the specified directory.

Returns:

(list) A list of tuples containing the input file path and the destination blob name.

sync.firebase.client module

class sync.firebase.client.FirebaseStorageManager(storage_url)[source]

Bases: object

A class for managing Firebase storage operations.

close_connection()[source]

Closes the Firebase connection.

copy_files(data_path, destination_folder)[source]

Copies files from the specified path to a destination folder.

Parameters:

  • data_path – (str) The path to copy files from.

  • destination_folder – (str) The destination folder to copy files to.

Returns:

(list) A list of tuples containing the source file name and the destination file name.

delete_files_in_path(data_path)[source]

Deletes all files in the specified path.

Parameters:

data_path – (str) The path to delete files from.

Returns:

(list) A list of deleted file names.

download_all_files_from_path(data_path, local_folder)[source]

Downloads all files from the specified path to the local folder.

Parameters:

  • data_path – (str) The path to download files from.

  • local_folder – (str) The local folder to download files to.

Returns:

(list) A list of tuples containing the original file path and the local file path.

exists(data_path)[source]

Checks if a file or folder exists in the specified path.

Parameters:

data_path – (str) The path to check.

Returns:

(bool) True if the file or folder exists, False otherwise.

get_presigned_url(data_path, expiration=3600)[source]

Generates a presigned URL for accessing a file.

Parameters:

  • data_path – (str) The path to the file.

  • expiration – (int) The expiration time in seconds for the presigned URL.

Returns:

(str) The presigned URL, or None if the file does not exist.

is_folder(blob)[source]

Checks if the blob is a folder.

Parameters:

blob – (google.cloud.storage.blob.Blob) The blob to check.

Returns:

(bool) True if the blob is a folder, False otherwise.

list_all_files_in_path(data_path, recursive=False)[source]

Lists all files in the specified path.

Parameters:

  • data_path – (str) The path to list files from.

  • recursive – (bool) If True, include subdirectories; otherwise, only list files in the specified directory.

Returns:

(list) A list of file paths.

read_file_from_presigned_url(presigned_url)[source]

Reads content of a file from a presigned URL.

Parameters:

presigned_url – (str) The presigned URL of the file to be read.

Returns:

str: The content of the file, or an error message.

Raises:

requests.exceptions.RequestException – If an error occurs during the HTTP request.

upload_file_to_path(data_path, local_file_path)[source]

Uploads a file to the specified path.

Parameters:

  • data_path – (str) The path to upload the file to.

  • local_file_path – (str) The local file path to upload.

Returns:

(tuple) A tuple containing the input file path and the destination blob name.

upload_folder_to_path(data_path, local_folder, recursive=False)[source]

Uploads a folder to the specified path.

Parameters:

  • data_path – (str) The path to upload the folder to.

  • local_folder – (str) The local folder to upload.

  • recursive – (bool) If True, upload subdirectories; otherwise, only upload files in the specified directory.

Returns:

(list) A list of tuples containing the input file path and the destination blob name.
